html:
1

Editor's Choice

Youth To The People Superfood Air-Whip Lightweight Face Moisturizer with Hyaluronic Acid

Cons
  • Might not be suitable for oily skin

If you were a bit weary about eating your vegetables as a kid, your parents would be very happy to hear that you are consistently taking your daily dose of spinach and kale—even if it’s in the form of a moisturizer. This airy formula might feel lightweight on the skin but is chock-full of nourishing ingredients. Hyaluronic acid, vitamins, and green tea work together to combat dryness and signs of aging, like fine lines and wrinkles.

Size: 2 oz

Sephora rating: 4.4/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I love how light this moisturizer feels on my skin. Having very dry skin myself, I was always under the impression that I'd need a thick cream to feel hydrated, but this cream keeps my skin feeling moisturized all day long.”—Tasha Nicole Smith, beauty assistant

2

Best Body Cream

Jo Malone London Vitamin E Body Balm

The benefits of skin care don’t have to be reserved for your face when you can give your body the same amount of love. This rich body cream is packed with a blend of vitamin E, apricot oil, and hyaluronic acid to smooth and moisturize your skin.

Size: 6.5 oz

Nordstrom rating: 4.8/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “This is a powerhouse body balm. It is luxuriously rich and buttery but also absorbs quickly, leaving skin feeling nourished, soothed, soft, and, calm. If you’re prone to allergies or dry itchy skin, this really helps calm the skin (and results are as much instant as they are long term).”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

3

Best Value

MALIN+GOETZ Vitamin E Moisturizer

If you deal with sensitive or reactive skin, redness and irritation can be a common occurrence. This gentle, non-greasy formula nourishes your ace using vitamins E and B5 to prevent irritation and ward off dry skin.

Size: 8 oz

Nordstrom rating: 4.3/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “I have been looking for a great new moisturizer and tried other products from this brand before and decided to give it a try. This product is light weight and not oily. I've used it everyday for about 6 months now and have no plans to switch to another face moisturizer.”

4

Best Affordable Option

the inkey list Vitamin B, C, and E Moisturizer

Cons
  • Works best with products from the same line

Getting healthy-looking skin doesn’t always mean splurging on the most expensive products and treatments. This affordable daily moisturizer combats dehydrated skin with nourishing niacinamide, which helps control excess oils, as a blend of vitamins brightens and relaxes the skin.

Size: 1.7 oz

Sephora rating: 4/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “This is such a staple in my beauty routine! For the price it’s become my favorite moisturizer. I use it right out of the shower after cleansing with the oat balm by the same brand and I love it.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

5

Best Night Cream

Mario Badescu Vitamin E Night Cream

Using a thicker, more concentrated consistency at night helps to replenish your skin as you sleep so that you wake up with a radiant, healthy glow. Along with vitamin E, this cream has cocoa butter and cotton seed oil to lock in moisture.

Size: 1 oz

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I love this night cream – I was a little wary at first because it goes on thick and very oily, but the difference it has made in my skin is incredible. It not only leaves my skin very well-hydrated and healthy-feeling, it somehow also helped get rid of my acne and texture on my forehead. I am genuinely shocked at the difference it has made in my skin and now won't go a single night without using it.”

6

Best to Relieve Irritated Skin

Derma E Derma E Tea Tree and Vitamin E Relief Cream – Deeply Moisturizing Tea Tree Lotion – Vitamin E Cream Soothes, Calms and Nourishes Dry, Irritated Skin, 4 oz

Cons
  • Might not be suitable for sensitive skin

When your skin is feeling stressed or dull, and you’re looking for total relief, this tea tree cream calms and revives your tired skin. This clean brand uses naturally derived ingredients to ease itchy and irritated skin. The hydrating formula is gentle enough for daily use and won’t feel sticky or heavy.

Size: 4 oz

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I can't get enough of this stuff. I know the smell is not for everyone but I absolutely love it. It's moisturizing, it has a slight cooling/tingling sensation, and it works so well. I could probably take a bath in it and I'd be happy. I'm a huge fan of Derma-E and this solidified my love for that company.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

7

Best for Soft Skin

Peter Thomas Roth Potent-C Brightening Vitamin C Moisturizer

Cons
  • Small amount of product per bottle

For youthful-looking, visibly healthier skin, this cream uses vitamin C and E to brighten the skin and reduce the appearance of dark spots. Rich with antioxidants and a superfood complex, this moisturizer deeply penetrates and hydrates, giving you plump, glass skin-like results.

Size: 1.7 oz

Sephora rating: 4.6/stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “I have sensitive skin and tend to break out easily but didn’t have any issues at all with this moisturizer. I own a few different medical grade moisturizers and always reach back for this one. It truly makes my skin better overnight.”

What are the benefits of using Vitamin E Creams?

While it might just seem like a buzzy skincare trend, vitamin E actually has major restorative benefits. “Vitamin E creams can help keep your skin moisturized and hydrated, reduce the appearance of fine lines and uneven textures, and help improve skin elasticity,” says Brownlee. “People with dry, mature, or sensitive skin would benefit the most from using Vitamin E.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

It is said that vitamin E works best in conjunction with vitamin C. Why is that?

Every superhero needs their right-hand man. That's kind of how vitamins E and C work together. They support each other to help repair your skin. “Vitamin E works best in conjunction with vitamin C because vitamin C helps to regenerate vitamin E after it’s been oxidized,” says Brownlee. “Because of this, vitamin E can continue to work for a longer period of time. The synergistic effect of combining the two allows Vitamin E to be more effective than when used alone.”
